page.title: 03POPULATION
page.content: The region has one area of high development i.e.the village of Long Stratton, which is situated on both sides of the main A140 trunk road. This road was built by the Romans as a main route from Norwich to Ipswich. Therefore the village has become a very convenient position for people to live who need to travel to Norwich (9 miles), and it has become a commuter village, with a population of 2,304. The other parish in the area is Wacton. This village has a population of 259. Part of the parish of Forncett forms the remains of the area.
